Author: akaneo#3021
Content: may anyone help me with the qt wallet ?

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: i'm on ubuntu 18

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: i run ./fetch-params.sh and waited until it finished

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: now when i try to run ./komodo-qt-linux it gives me this error "Error: Cannot parse configuration file: Missing komodo.conf. Only use key=value syntax."

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: just received a friend request üòÉ

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: i suppose support team wont do that...

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @akaneo can you use the cli?

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: no

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: ok, go to home directory

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: i am

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: CTRL + H

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: nothing happens on ctrl h

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: see if there is a directory named `.komodo`

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: it is

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: but it is empty

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: create file name komodo.conf

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: done

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: ~/.komodo$ touch komodo.conf

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
txindex=1
addnode=5.9.102.210
addnode=78.47.196.146
addnode=178.63.69.164
addnode=88.198.65.74
addnode=5.9.122.241
addnode=144.76.94.38
addnode=89.248.166.91
onlynet=ipv4
rpcuser=komodo
rpcpassword=local321
rpcallowip=127.0.0.1
rpcbind=127.0.0.1
server=1
```

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: inside it

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
change these
```
rpcuser=komodo
rpcpassword=local321
```
to more secure ones

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: done

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: now try to start the wallet

Author: akaneo#3021
Content: it launched

Content: thanks a lot
